From: "Mattias Fagerlund" <mattias@...>
Subject: Re: [neat] Another New Paper:  Multiagent HyperNEAT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=29390171; y=7sCu0jNaXWfJKxFYxSGDfuMl6CHAWbXpZUDhfWAikHH8411wT_1BJW85dGw
X-Yahoo-Profile: mattias_fagerlund

Hi, a very interesting paper and the videos are great. Looks like it could
be very useful in game ai development, among other things, they co-operate
beautifully.

One question I had while reading the paper is what would happen if you
instead of using r(x), you simply supply a new input node per agent that
represents it's original position? I.e. the position wouldn't be involved
in the conversion from genotype to phenotype, instead it would be present
in each individual.

with regards,
mattias
